newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Pepsi says sold 1,000 restaurants in past 18 mos.
newsitem.headline: Pepsi says sold 1,000 restaurants in past 18 mos.

text.p: U.S. soft drinks and fast food giant PepsiCo said it had sold worldwide one thousand company-owned restaurants to franchisees over the past year and a half and that it would continue that policy as franchisees were more efficient.

"We are in fact in the process of selling off company-owned restaurants and franchising them out... as we believe the franchisers can do a better job," PepsiCo CEO Roger Enrico told a press conference marking the return of Pepsi to the Venezuelan market.
"The fact that Pepsi is a large restaurant and snack food manufacturer doesn't mean we've lost focus," Enrico said.

Pepsi was effectively ousted from the Venezuelan market in August when the country's leading bottler Grupo Cisneros Emotelladoras de Venezuela broke a franchise agreement with the company to enter a joint venture with arch rival Coca- Cola.
Pepsi subsequently signed a joint venture agreement in November with leading Venezuelan foods and beverage company Polar to bottle and distribute Pepsi in Venezuela.
Sales are seen recovering to 50 million cases by mid-1997. The entire Venezuelan soft drinks market is estimated at 200 million cases.
